title: 95/460/EC: Commission Decision of 19 October 1995 concerning a request for exemption lodged by the Federal Republic of Germany pursuant to Article 8 (2) (c) of Council Directive 70/156/EEC on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to the type-approval of motor vehicles and their trailers (Only the German text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION  of 19 October 1995 concerning a request for exemption lodged by the Federal Republic of Germany  pursuant to Article 8 (2) (c) of Council Directive 70/156/EEC on the approximation of the laws of  the Member States relating to the type-approval of motor vehicles and their trailers (Only the  German text is authentic) (95/460/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The Commission hereby approves the request lodged by the Federal  Republic of Germany, as consolidated by the request of 5 December 1994, pursuant to Article 8 (2)  (c) of Directive 70/156/EEC, for an exemption concerning one type of gas discharge light source to  be installed in four types of headlamps intended to be fitted to motor vehicles.
This request is granted on condition that such vehicles are equipped with an automatic beam  levelling system, a headlamp cleaning system and a system guaranteeing a permanent dipped beam.
This Decision is addressed to the Federal Republic of Germany.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 19 October 1995.
For the Commission Martin BANGEMANN Member of the Commission
